---

# f5xc_cloud_credentials (Resource)

API to create cloud_credentials object

~> **Note** For more information about this resource, please refer to the [F5 XC API Documentation](https://docs.cloud.f5.com/docs/api/).

## Example Usage

```terraform
resource "f5xc_cloud_credentials" "example" {
  name      = "example"
  namespace = "system"

  labels = {
    "env" = "production"
  }
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `name` (String) Name of the CloudCredentials. Must be unique within the namespace.
- `namespace` (String) Namespace where the CloudCredentials will be created.

### Optional

- `annotations` (Map of String) Annotations to apply to this resource.
- `aws_assume_role` (Block, Optional) AWS Assume Role to Handle Delegated Access. AWS Assume Role to Handle Delegated Access (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--aws_assume_role))
- `aws_secret_key` (Block, Optional) AWS Programmatic Access Credentials. AWS Programmatic Access Credentials type (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--aws_secret_key))
- `azure_client_secret` (Block, Optional) Azure Client Secret. Azure Credentials Client Secret type (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--azure_client_secret))
- `azure_pfx_certificate` (Block, Optional) Client Certificate. Azure Credentials Client Certificate type (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--azure_pfx_certificate))
- `gcp_cred_file` (Block, Optional) GCP Credentials. GCP Credentials type (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--gcp_cred_file))
- `labels` (Map of String) Labels to apply to this resource.

### Read-Only

- `id` (String) Unique identifier for the resource.

### Nested Schema for `aws_assume_role`

Optional:

- `custom_external_id` (String) External ID is Custom ID. Exclusive with [external_id_is_optional external_id_is_tenant_id] External ID is Custom ID ves.io.schema.rules.string.max_len: 64 ves.io.schema.rules.string.min_len: 2
- `duration_seconds` (Number) Role Session Duration Seconds. The duration, in seconds of the role session. ves.io.schema.rules.uint32.gte: 3600 ves.io.schema.rules.uint32.lte: 43200
- `external_id_is_optional` (Block, Optional) Empty. This can be used for messages where no values are needed (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--aws_assume_role--external_id_is_optional))
- `external_id_is_tenant_id` (Block, Optional) Empty. This can be used for messages where no values are needed (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--aws_assume_role--external_id_is_tenant_id))
- `role_arn` (String) IAM Role ARN. IAM Role ARN to assume the role Required: YES ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true ves.io.schema.rules.string.max_len: 2048 ves.io.schema.rules.string.min_len: 20 ves.io.schema.rules.string.pattern: ^(arn:aws:iam::)([0-9]{12}:role/.*)$
- `session_name` (String) Role Session Name. Use the role session name to uniquely identify a session, which will be used for deploy, monitor from F5XC console Required: YES ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true ves.io.schema.rules.string.max_len: 64 ves.io.schema.rules.string.min_len: 2*
- `session_tags` (Block, Optional) Role Session Tags. Session tags are key-value pair attributes that you pass when you assume an IAM role ves.io.schema.rules.map.keys.string.max_len: 127 ves.io.schema.rules.map.max_pairs: 40 ves.io.schema.rules.map.values.string.max_len: 255 (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--aws_assume_role--session_tags))

### Nested Schema for `aws_secret_key`

Optional:

- `access_key` (String) Access Key ID. Access key ID for your AWS account Required: YES ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true ves.io.schema.rules.string.max_len: 128
- `secret_key` (Block, Optional) Secret. SecretType is used in an object to indicate a sensitive/confidential field (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--aws_secret_key--secret_key))

<a id="nestedblock--aws_secret_key--secret_key"></a>
### Nested Schema for `aws_secret_key.secret_key`

Optional:

- `blindfold_secret_info` (Block, Optional) Blindfold Secret. BlindfoldSecretInfoType specifies information about the Secret managed by F5XC Secret Management (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--aws_secret_key--secret_key--blindfold_secret_info))
- `clear_secret_info` (Block, Optional) In-Clear Secret. ClearSecretInfoType specifies information about the Secret that is not encrypted. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--aws_secret_key--secret_key--clear_secret_info))

<a id="nestedblock--aws_secret_key--secret_key--blindfold_secret_info"></a>
### Nested Schema for `aws_secret_key.secret_key.blindfold_secret_info`

Optional:

- `decryption_provider` (String) Decryption Provider. Name of the Secret Management Access object that contains information about the backend Secret Management service.
- `location` (String) Location. Location is the uri_ref. It could be in url format for string:/// Or it could be a path if the store provider is an http/https location Required: YES ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true ves.io.schema.rules.string.uri_ref: true
- `store_provider` (String) Store Provider. Name of the Secret Management Access object that contains information about the store to get encrypted bytes This field needs to be provided only if the url scheme is not string:///


<a id="nestedblock--aws_secret_key--secret_key--clear_secret_info"></a>
### Nested Schema for `aws_secret_key.secret_key.clear_secret_info`

Optional:

- `provider_ref` (String) Provider. Name of the Secret Management Access object that contains information about the store to get encrypted bytes This field needs to be provided only if the url scheme is not string:///
- `url` (String) URL. URL of the secret. Currently supported URL schemes is string:///. For string:/// scheme, Secret needs to be encoded Base64 format. When asked for this secret, caller will get Secret bytes after Base64 decoding. Required: YES ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true ves.io.schema.rules.string.max_bytes: 131072 ves.io.schema.rules.string.uri_ref: true

### Nested Schema for `azure_pfx_certificate`

Optional:

- `certificate_url` (String) URL for Client Certificate. URL for Client Certificate in '.pfx' or '.p12' whose certificate is linked to service principal object Certificate URL can contain client certificate in string:///<Base64 of certificate> format. Here <Base64 of certificate> is base64 of '.pfx' or '.p12' binary file Required: YES ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true ves.io.schema.rules.string.max_len: 8192 ves.io.schema.rules.string.uri_ref: true
- `client_id` (String) Client ID. Client ID for your Azure service principal Required: YES ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true ves.io.schema.rules.string.max_len: 64

- `subscription_id` (String) Subscription ID. Subscription ID for your Azure service principal Required: YES ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true ves.io.schema.rules.string.max_len: 64

## Import

Import is supported using the following syntax:

```shell
# Import using namespace/name format
terraform import f5xc_cloud_credentials.example system/example
```
